Description: Illinois Wage Payment and Collection Act
Info Source: Contained in data obtained on April 18, 2017 in response to an Illinois Freedom of Information Act request.

Description: Just Energy Group agreed to pay $4 million in settlement of allegations  of deceptive marketing.
Multiple violation relating to consumer protection protocols set by the utility commission

The Commission approved a settlement with Just Energy concerning switchhold removal and the low-income rate reduction program. The company agreed to pay an administrative penalty of $475,000 and contribute an additional $225,000 to bill payment assistance programs.
Just Energy agreed to pay a $111,000 fine and change its sales practices as part of a settlement with state officials that will allow the natural-gas supplier to continue to operate in the state.
Info Source: Natural-gas firm fined for its sales practices; Marketer agrees to safeguards for consumers, Columbus Dispatch, November 5, 2010 (via Nexis).

Description: The Illinois Commerce Commission fined alternative gas supplier Just Energy $90,000 for violations of the Alternative Gas Supplier Law (AGSL) and ordered an independent audit of its sales practices.
This violation is for a Resource Adequacy deficiency that was either not remedied at all or remedied after five business days from the date of notification by the Energy Division
